header_summary: The context discusses the v=2 nonces signing protocol of musig2 and the challenges of preventing attacks and maintaining confidentiality. It also addresses the concerns about the growth of "inscriptions" on the blockchain and the need for options to reject them. Additionally, it explores proposals for using MuSig2 signing for mutual closes and the complexities of pricing fees and implementing an ideal payment system.

enteries.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
enteries.summary: - The v=2 nonces signing protocol of musig2 is designed to prevent the Wagner attack by blinding the challenge value c from the server.- The key aggregation coefficient of 1 for each key in statecoin transfer prevents "rogue key attacks" and ensures a valid signature over the aggregate key.- The updated key generation protocol involves the server generating a private key x1 and a public key X1, while the user generates a private key x2, a public key X2, and a random blinding nonce z.

enteries.title: Concern about "Inscriptions".
enteries.summary: - The bug pertaining to the "inscriptions" developed by @rodarmor has caused a rapid growth in size on the blockchain, impacting the UTXO set and resulting in daily growth of 25MB.- Current options in Bitcoin Core do not effectively address the issue of inscriptions, with the only available patch being impractical for most users.- Implementing a feature that allows users to reject inscriptions in the mempool would help mitigate the negative impact and protect the integrity of the network.

enteries.title: LN Summit 2023 Notes
enteries.summary: - Proposal to use tapscript branch for unilateral closes instead of MuSig2 signing for commitment transactions.- Consideration of dynamic unconditional fees based on demand rather than static fees.- Challenges in setting failure thresholds and reputation-based solutions for preventing attacks in the network.
